column1: #Text=All polycrystalline samples were synthesized by solid state reaction in evacuated quartz tubes.
#Text=The mixtures of stoichiometric amounts of elements, Mo (purity 99.9%), Nb (purity 99.9%), and
#Text=Te (purity 99.999%), in powder form were heated at 1050-1100 ◦C for 12 h, followed by cooling
#Text=The obtained samples were ground, pelletized, and then annealed
#Text=at selected temperatures between 800 and 1100 ◦C for 12 h.
#Text=after water quenching, except for 2H-MoTe2 which was cooled to room temperature by furnace
#Text=Powder XRD patterns were corrected on a Bruker D8 advance diffractometer using Cu K α
#Text=For transport measurements, the samples were cut into rectangular shape in the typical
#Text=The thermopower and thermal conductivity were measured by a
#Text=conventional steady-state method with a temperature difference of less than 1 K between the voltage
